Compare Batching Options

batching-comparison.Rmd

Overview

This vignette compares different approaches to batching LLM operations in R, looking at three main packages:

  • hellmer: Synchronous batch processing across providers
  • tidyllm: Asynchronous batch processing across providers
  • mall: Local model batch processing with Ollama

Package Comparison

hellmer

Focuses on synchronous batch processing across multiple providers via ellmer:

library(hellmer)

chat <- chat_batch(chat_claude())
result <- chat$batch(prompts)

Key features:

  • Sequential and parallel processing
  • State persistence and recovery
  • Progress tracking
  • Automatic retry with backoff
  • Supports tooling and structured data extraction

tidyllm

Offers asynchronous batch processing across multiple providers:

library(tidyllm)

batch_id <- messages |> 
  send_batch(claude())
results <- fetch_batch(batch_id, claude())

Key features:

  • Asynchronous processing
  • Multiple provider support
  • Provider-specific batch APIs
  • Status checking capabilities

mall

Provides synchronous batching for local Ollama models:

library(mall)

results <- data |>
  llm_sentiment(text)

Key features:

  • Row-wise dataframe processing
  • Integrated caching
  • Pre-built NLP task prompts
  • dplyr pipeline integration

When to Use Each Package

  • Use hellmer for robust error handling, progress monitoring, and state management
  • Use tidyllm for asynchronous processing across multiple providers
  • Use mall for local Ollama models and pre-built NLP tasks

Performance Considerations

  • Synchronous (hellmer, mall): Immediate feedback, blocks until completion
  • Asynchronous (tidyllm): Better for long-running jobs, requires status checking
  • Resource Usage: Local (mall) vs API-based (tidyllm, hellmer)
